title: The Sapir-Whorf Hypothesis
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Sapir-Whorf Hypothesis.

hook.text: The Hopi language has no past tense. Does that mean the Hopi experience time differently? A fierce debate erupted.

twist.text: Russian speakers distinguish light blue and dark blue faster than English speakers.

climax.text: Language doesn't imprison thought. But it does create grooves that make some thoughts easier and others harder.

punchline.text: Your language doesn't limit what you can think. It shapes what you notice first.
